p: Chlorhexidine is a broadband antimicrobial agent with a bactericidal and bacteriostatic effect [ 27]. The antibacterial effect of CHX is concentration dependent, whereas high concentrations of CHX might negatively affect the physical and mechanical properties of GIC [ 28, 29]. 0.5% of CHX (w/w) was chosen in the current study to be added to GIC powder, based on studies reporting that this percentage might be the best option for incorporation of CHX into GIC, since antibacterial activity increased and the physical–mechanical properties were not compromised [ 30– 32].
